coxstream 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

Streaming Cox model with repeated observations

Source: R/coxstream.R
coxstream.Rd

Usage

coxstream(formula, data, n_basis, boundary, idx_col, scale = 2)

Arguments

formula

A formula expression as for regression models, of the form response ~ predictors. The response must be a survival object as returned by the Surv function.

data

A data frame containing the variables in the model.

n_basis

A positive odd integer specifying the number of fourier basis functions.

boundary

A vector of length 2 containing the boundary knots.

idx_col

The column name of the index column, which is used to distinguish different patients.

scale

The scaling factor for the pre-estimated coefficients.

Value

An object of class coxstream.

Examples

library(coxstream)
formula <- survival::Surv(time, status) ~ X1 + X2 + X3 + X4 + X5
fit <- coxstream(
  formula, sim[sim$batch_id == 1, ],
  n_basis = 7, boundary = c(0, 3), idx_col = "patient_id"
)
for (batch in 2:10) {
  fit <- update(fit, sim[sim$batch_id == batch, ], nu = 0.4)
}
summary(fit)
#> Call:
#> coxstream(formula = formula, data = sim[sim$batch_id == 1, ], 
#>     n_basis = 7, boundary = c(0, 3), idx_col = "patient_id")
#> 
#>       coef exp(coef)      se     z      p    
#> X1 0.98440   2.67621 0.05058 19.46 <2e-16 ***
#> X2 1.01234   2.75202 0.05282 19.17 <2e-16 ***
#> X3 1.01546   2.76063 0.05294 19.18 <2e-16 ***
#> X4 0.87865   2.40766 0.05111 17.19 <2e-16 ***
#> X5 1.03593   2.81771 0.05038 20.56 <2e-16 ***
#> ---
#> Signif. codes:  0 ‘***’ 0.001 ‘**’ 0.01 ‘*’ 0.05 ‘.’ 0.1 ‘ ’ 1
#>    exp(coef) exp(-coef) lower .95 upper .95
#> X1 2.6762    0.3737     2.4236    2.9551   
#> X2 2.7520    0.3634     2.4814    3.0522   
#> X3 2.7606    0.3622     2.4885    3.0625   
#> X4 2.4077    0.4153     2.1782    2.6613   
#> X5 2.8177    0.3549     2.5528    3.1101
